intro: Galium calvipes, commonly known as smooth bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptic to ovate, and have a smooth, hairless surface. Galium calvipes is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
